review_title: Beware, Not a good place to work
pros: They take good care of the patients.
cons: You won’t get proper training. Managers will lie to cover up their own poor performance. You won’t get any feedback until you are being escorted out. You get no training on things as simple as your medical insurance. Almost no support at all. Very unorganized. You are expected to work 8-8, or manager will get angry and give poor reviews.

pros: Great facility loving environment small-town feel. Good benefits great lunch options and free employee parking along with some wonderful perks throughout the Metroplex because hospital employees get a lot of discounts.
cons: The " good old boy " system is alive and well at Texas Scottish Rite Hospital! Unfair treatment to employees in these departments security, environmental services, medical records, grounds keeping. Most department heads have been with the hospital for ages and are stuck in the past with ways of operations relating to work ethic.  In my experience if you vibrant, ambitious and are between the ages of 25 - 38 you will be met with resistance and possibly seen as a threat. I say this because the technology inside of the hospital in most departments are outdated and when a young vibrant individual steps in showing intelligence /new ideas unfortunately it's not taken well among the older staff members in a majority of cases.

job_title: Dietary Assistant Deli Clerk in Dallas, TX
pros:
Hello,
I decided to put another review on here a year later. I still feel the same about Scottish Rite, I'm still very appreciative for Shonna Norman in HR for noticing my resume and passing to my boss Kim Oberman. Thanks to Mr. Walker for being a great CEO. It's really a fun place to work everyone greets each other and I love seeing my customers at the Deli this time last year I was just starting and didn't really know anyone, today.. it's good morning..how are you?...have a great day..have a good weekend. Everyone knows my name!! It's awesome to have every weekend off and the holidays. It's nice to greet the little kiddies and their families.
cons: The only thing I can think of is the competitive wages. I think they should be up to date.

review_title: Outstanding mission, solid employer but better for those with families.
pros: Many people are attracted to work at TSRHC because of the incredible work they do with children which is absolutely valid. The hospital puts the needs of the children first and most staff and volunteers do everything possible to ensure the patients and their families are well taken care of. The staff is friendly and the hospital provides a number of wellness opportunities for staff to take advantage of.
cons: Salary and promotion opportunities are limited by the non- profit nature and the very low turnover (a positive in many ways) of the staff. In addition, the hospital doesn't really cater to a younger work force as many of the benefits and staff recreation opportunities are family focused. Its not necessarily a bad thing but is worth considering.

review_title: I patrolled the premises and dispatched calls throughout the building.
pros: It was a family oriented environment and not fast paced. They really made sure the patients as well as employees enjoyed their experience while there. They promoted good health and lifestyle.
cons: Sometimes because it wasn't fast paced, the days seem to be longer than normal. Due to it being downtown, I had to deal with traffic and longer commute. The salary was less than other hospitals doing the same job and the raise ratio was reduced.

pros: The goals and culture of the organization are easy to align persoannaly with and feel proud to support.
cons: There is very little diversity in the hospital clinical or administrative leadership.  The current leadership is primarily comprised of white men, including the board, administration, and clinicians.  It feels like a good old boys network with very limited growth opportunities.  It is a very highly controlled, mother-may-I, environment with limited empowerment and trust of employees

pros: Feeling like you made a difference in a child's life.
cons: Now that they charge the Administration and Board have become greedy, not the same happy place.  People use to care about each other now it's cut throat.

pros: Over-all good working environment, pretty decent compensation. Hours are nice if you're not working a nurses 12 hour shift. Most departments seem to have pretty laid-back management, which is nice for work/life balance.
cons: Compensation could easily be better. One disadvantage is that it seems difficult to move up the salary scale, even if you're taking on more responsibilities. Not all positions seem to pay equally, even considering experience and performance.

pros: Love the environment. Everyone is friendly. Love the hospital events
cons: Over worked, Underpaid, no room for growth. If you are liked by your manager and would love to move within the company. The manager can block you from doing so even if their isnt any disciplinary actions against yourself.!

pros: Great patients. Ability to provide great care to change lives of kids.
cons: Administration is good old boy club. Top administrators award friends and pushes out loyal employees to make room for friends.

pros: Work hospital doing is great. Little unorganized at times. Promotes within which can be good and bad.
cons: Low salary. Need to get more experienced people in to truly take hospital where it needs to go.
